page.title: 12HEALTH:WOODTON AREA
page.content: There are no G.P.s,hospital services or pharmacists in this area,so people go to one of the nearby medical prac- tices for primary health care,or to hospitals in Norwich for specialist care.There are G.P.s' surgeries at Bungay,Saxlingham,Hempnall & Brooke,& any drugs prescribed are dispensed at these.Those needing physiotherapy may be sent to Beccles or Gt Yarmouth.Most women go to Norfolk & Norwich Hospital to have a baby;home confinements are not encouraged.The nearest dentists & chiropodists are at Bungay or Norwich. The elderly can go to a day centre at Hempnall,but if they need care there are "homes" at Ditchingham,Chedgrave & Earsham,etc.,or the geriatric wards at Whitlingham Hospital.Finally the small hospital run by the nuns of the Community of All Hallows, Ditchingham provides loving terminal care.
